intro: Erythrochlamys fruticosa, commonly known as the red-flowered shrub, is a perennial plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woody growth habit and produces clusters of vibrant red flowers during the spring and summer months. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its ornamental value is largely due to its striking floral display and compact size.
